greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime whose product of digits is 7^n.
example: a(6) = 1177717771 because its digital product is 7^6.
mathematica: NextPrim[n_] := Block[{k = n + 1}, While[ !PrimeQ[k], k++ ]; k]; a = Table[0, {18}]; p = 2; Do[q = Log[7, Times @@ IntegerDigits[p]]; If[q != 0 && IntegerQ[q] && a[[q]] == 0, a[[q]] = p; Print[q, " = ", p]]; p = NextPrim[p], {n, 1, 10^9}]
For a(8); a = Map[ FromDigits, Permutations[{1, 1, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7}]]; Min[ Select[a, PrimeQ[ # ] &]]
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 09 2003
